Package datastructure

Class VariantContentTable

java.lang.Object
datastructure.VariantContentTable
public final class VariantContentTable
extends java.lang.Object
Major data structure to store the results of Musial.

Implements a variety of thread safe data structures to store the information parsed from `.vcf` files. In addition accessor methods to retrieve the stored data either as statistics or in a String format for the generation of human readable output are implemented.

Since:
2.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Simon Hackl

  • Field Details

    • table

      private final java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<VariantContent>>>> table
      Thread safe table structure that stores all information parsed from `.vcf` files in the form of VariantContent instances.

      The first key represents the analyzed reference feature, e.g. in the case of a full genome analysis the internal name of the genome or in the case of single genes the gene names.

      The second key represents the name of the analyzed sample.

      The third key represents the position on the reference as a String. In the most cases this will simply be the String representation of the Integer position, however, to represent an insertion in any sample `+i` is appended: I.e. if an insertion at position 10 of length 2 was analyzed, the keys 10+1 and 10+2 will be used. The third key set is sorted by the VariantPositionComparator. This system allows for an easy insertion of `-` gap symbols in those samples in which no insertion occurred.

      The final values stored are ConcurrentLinkedQueue instances that contain VariantContent objects, i.e. multiple VariantContent objects are stored if a sample had a het. call at any position. The concurrent linked queue implementation allows the VariantContent objects to stay sorted according to their frequency.

    • variantPositions

      private final java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListSet<java.lang.String>> variantPositions
      Thread safe structure mapping reference feature names to a list of positions at which a variant was called.

  • Method Details

    • putVariantPosition

      public void putVariantPosition​(java.lang.String referenceFeatureName, java.lang.String sampleName, java.lang.String position, char content, double quality, double coverage, double frequency, boolean isMfa, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> additionalAnnotation)
      Inserts a new VariantContent instance into the table structure.
      Parameters:
      referenceFeatureName - String the name of the reference feature to access.
      sampleName - String representing the analyzed sample.
      position - String representing the analyzed position.
      content - Character representing the nucleotide content to insert.
      quality - Double representing the quality of the analyzed position.
      coverage - Double representing the coverage of the analyzed position.
      frequency - Double representing the frequency of the analyzed content.
      isMfa - Boolean indicating if the content is from the most frequently observed allele.
      additionalAnnotation - HashMap containing key, value pairs of String that reflect annotations associated with the variant content.

    • countRejectedCall

      public void countRejectedCall​(java.lang.String referenceFeatureName, java.lang.String sampleName, java.lang.String position)
      Increments the rejected call counter by one for the specified reference feature (i.e. accessed via `referenceFeatureName`), position and sample.
      Parameters:
      referenceFeatureName - String specifying the reference feature for which the counter shall be incremented.
      sampleName - String specifying the sample for which the count shall be increased.
      position - String specifying the position for which the count shall be increased.

    • countCallType

      public void countCallType​(java.lang.String referenceFeatureName, java.lang.String sampleName, boolean isHet)
      Increments the respective call type counter by one for the specified reference feature (i.e. accessed via `referenceFeatureName`) and sample, dependent on the value of `isHet`.
      Parameters:
      referenceFeatureName - String specifying the reference feature for which the counter shall be incremented.
      sampleName - String specifying the sample for which the count shall be increased.
      isHet - Boolean specifying the call type, i.e. false for hom. and true for het. calls.

    • countAlternateCall

      public void countAlternateCall​(java.lang.String referenceFeatureName, java.lang.String sampleName, java.lang.String position, char content)
      Increments the variant call counter by one for the specified reference feature (i.e. accessed via `referenceFeatureName`), position and sample. Which counter is increased depends on the specified `content` and `position`.
      Parameters:
      referenceFeatureName - String specifying the reference feature for which the counter shall be incremented.
      sampleName - String specifying the sample for which the count shall be increased.
      position - String specifying the position for which the count shall be increased.
      content - Character specifying the variants nucleotide content.

    • addSampleToReference

      public void addSampleToReference​(java.lang.String referenceFeatureName, java.lang.String sampleName)
      Inserts empty ConcurrentHashMap and ConcurrentSkipListMap structures into the table if none are present for a specified reference analysis entry and sample name.

      This method is intended to be used for samples with only confident reference calls as these will not be considered for the output files otherwise.

      Parameters:
      referenceFeatureName - String the name of the reference feature to access.
      sampleName - String representing the name of the sample.

    • getContent

      public java.util.Iterator<VariantContent> getContent​(java.lang.String referenceFeatureName, java.lang.String sampleName, java.lang.String position)
      Returns an Iterator of VariantContent objects, if stored in the table.

      Returns null if no entry exists.

      Parameters:
      referenceFeatureName - String representing the reference analysis identifier / feature identifier to access.
      sampleName - String representing the sample identifier to access.
      position - String representing the position to access.
      Returns:
      Iterator of VariantContent objects, if stored in the table; else null.

    • putDeletion

      public void putDeletion​(java.lang.String referenceFeatureName, java.lang.String sampleName, java.lang.String position, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> consecutivelyDeletedPositions)
      Inserts a new block of consecutively deleted positions with respect to the specified sample and reference location starting exclusively at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      referenceFeatureName - String the name of the reference location.
      sampleName - String the name of the sample.
      position - String the identifier of the position.
      consecutivelyDeletedPositions - ArrayList of Strings representing consecutively deleted positions in the specified sample and reference location.

    • getDeletion

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getDeletion​(java.lang.String referenceFeatureName, java.lang.String sampleName, java.lang.String position)
      Returns a block of consecutively deleted positions with respect to the specified sample and reference location starting exclusively at the specified position or null if no such entry is present.
      Parameters:
      referenceFeatureName - String the name of the reference location.
      sampleName - String the name of the sample.
      position - String the identifier of the position.
      Returns:
      ArrayList if the position is a starting point of a block of consecutively deleted positions or null.
